description: Complete task breakdown for the Roadmap Integration on deeplearning.ai project, based on the web-integration-plan.md phases, roles, and sprint plan. Tasks are sorted by priority order (Critical first), with dependencies and critical path identified for a 6-person contributor team.

project.name: Roadmap Integration on deeplearning.ai
project.description: Integrate the AI Career Roadmap UI into the deeplearning.ai site, enabling learners to choose clear paths, view next steps, and see platform gaps. Delivered by a 6-person contributor team with diverse skills.

workers.name: UX / Product Designer
workers.specialist_area: Information architecture, UX flows, UI design

tasks.task_name: Kickoff & Discovery: P1. Short Problem Statement
tasks.description: Define the core problem the roadmap integration should solve: Users think in goals, not taxonomies; landing page is a giant list without structure, hierarchy, or narrative.
requisites: Access to existing roadmap content and links
Agreement on target audience and scope
tasks.expected_output: A concise problem statement (<= 1 page) describing the user problem, current pain, and why a roadmap UI is needed; include assumptions and out-of-scope notes.
tasks.goal: Create shared alignment on the core problem to solve before research and design begin.
tasks.self_assign_instructions: Comment on linked issue to claim the task and add your GitHub handle.

acceptance_criteria: A concise problem statement (<= 1 page) describing the user problem, current pain, and why a roadmap UI is needed; include assumptions and out-of-scope notes.
verification_steps: Peer review output against goal + expected_output
Confirm dependencies are satisfied (if any)

tasks.description: List things not yet known but must validate: Do users prefer paths or graphs? Do advanced learners want personalization?
requisites: Complete task 1: Kickoff & Discovery: P1. Short Problem Statement
tasks.expected_output: A prioritized list of key unknowns and research questions that must be validated (e.g., preferred navigation model, level of personalization, and how users choose paths).
tasks.goal: Make uncertainty explicit so research and prototyping target the highest-risk assumptions.
tasks.self_assign_instructions: Comment on linked issue to claim the task and add your GitHub handle.

acceptance_criteria: A prioritized list of key unknowns and research questions that must be validated (e.g., preferred navigation model, level of personalization, and how users choose paths).
verification_steps: Peer review output against goal + expected_output
Confirm dependencies are satisfied (if any)

tasks.description: Define early hypothesis and business outcomes: Faster decision-making, clear starting point, clear next steps for new and existing learners.
requisites: Complete task 2: Kickoff & Discovery: P2. Key Unknowns
tasks.expected_output: A short list of measurable success indicators (KPIs) and hypotheses, including how they will be measured and what baseline/targets mean for this phase.
tasks.goal: Define what success looks like so the team can prioritize work and evaluate impact post-launch.
tasks.self_assign_instructions: Comment on linked issue to claim the task and add your GitHub handle.

acceptance_criteria: A short list of measurable success indicators (KPIs) and hypotheses, including how they will be measured and what baseline/targets mean for this phase.
verification_steps: Peer review output against goal + expected_output
Confirm dependencies are satisfied (if any)

tasks.description: Identify basic elements: Course attributes (difficulty, skills gained, duration, domain), skill nodes, relationships (prerequisite_of, etc.), user goal types.

tasks.description: Perform a controlled canary rollout to a subset of users, monitor for errors and KPI movement. Expected output: rollout notes and KPI snapshot.
requisites: Complete task 41: Docs: Runbook & Release Notes
tasks.expected_output: A canary rollout executed per plan, with monitoring notes and a KPI snapshot captured after the rollout window.
tasks.goal: Reduce launch risk by rolling out gradually and validating stability and impact.
tasks.self_assign_instructions: Comment on linked issue to claim the task and add your GitHub handle.

acceptance_criteria: A canary rollout executed per plan, with monitoring notes and a KPI snapshot captured after the rollout window.
verification_steps: Peer review output against goal + expected_output
Confirm dependencies are satisfied (if any)

tasks.description: Review KPIs after rollout, create prioritized iteration backlog and assign owners. Expected output: metrics report and backlog of improvements.
requisites: Complete task 25: Launch & Measure: Launch Plan & Roll-out
tasks.expected_output: A post-launch metrics review summary and a prioritized backlog of improvements with clear next actions and owners-to-be.
tasks.goal: Close the loop after rollout and drive the next iteration cycle.
tasks.self_assign_instructions: Comment on linked issue to claim the task and add your GitHub handle.

acceptance_criteria: A post-launch metrics review summary and a prioritized backlog of improvements with clear next actions and owners-to-be.
verification_steps: Peer review output against goal + expected_output
Confirm dependencies are satisfied (if any)
